alert.note: Alert for Henry (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 10:05AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Warren, southwestern Mercer, Henderson, northwestern McDonough, northeastern Hancock, eastern Henry, Des Moines, northeastern Lee and southern Louisa Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 1005 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Morning Sun to near West Point. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Morning Sun around 1010 AM CDT. Wapello, Middletown and Amber around 1015 AM CDT. Dallas City and Iowa Army Ammunition Plant around 1020 AM CDT. Oakville and Toolesboro around 1025 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include New Boston, Keithsburg, Carman, Gulf Port, Mannon, Joy, Terre Haute, Stronghurst, Millersburg, Aledo, Biggsville, Seaton, Raritan and Shale City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southeastern Iowa.
